intro: Rea lacerata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It produces small, edible fruits that are often consumed by birds and other wildlife. Rea lacerata is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient plant in its native habitat.
